intro: Uragoga xanthophylla, commonly known as the yellow leaf uragoga, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its vibrant yellow foliage and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. The plant belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species known for their ornamental value. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported healing properties. Uragoga xanthophylla thrives in moist, shaded environments and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth.
